dublin_core.dcvalue: In this paper we present a low power linear phase digital FIR filter which is a part of an ECG on Chip The ECG on Chip can be embedded into clothing to acquire the electrocardiogram ECG signal and send a warning message to a mobile phone or PDA if an abnormal ECG is detected The proposed new filter structure significantly reduces the arithmetic operations for each sample which in turn lowers the power consumption The filter is developed based on the interpolated finite impulse filter technique and is very attractive for a low cost and low power VLSI implementation
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-06T18:01:09Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2007-02-06
Conference proceedings : ... Annual International Conference of the IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society. IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society. Annual Conference
A Low Power Linear Phase Digital FIR Filter for Wearable ECG Devices.
